content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #93647 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?
while it isn't severe, we definitely shouldn't stabilize const param defaults with this bug, so imo P-critical :sweat_smile: either revert the stabilization or backport #93669
I think it's good idea to mark it P-critical or P-high to make sure it's tracked.
by reading the related PR #93669 that fixes this issue (especially the tests) it seems that this could be quite problematic, so in hindsight, I would assign a P-high and promote the beta backport
oh yes, I've just read the prev. comments. P-critical makes great sense either, this is something we don't want to land in stable
Question/thought: Is this a case where tracking bound vars got in the way? Or did it actually help uncover a potential bug?
